question: A 26
sols_html:
Proceeding as in the hint, we have

\(\det(A-I\lambda) = \det\left( \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix} -\begin{bmatrix} \lambda & 0 \\ 0 & \lambda \end{bmatrix} \right) = \det\left( \begin{bmatrix} -\lambda & 1 \\ 1 & -\lambda \end{bmatrix} \right) = \lambda^{2}-1 = (\lambda-1)(\lambda+1)\)

and so the eigenvalues are given by \(\lambda = \pm1\)
